subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Convertible Notes: The Simple First Deal
description: A micro-lesson that makes Convertible Notes: The Simple First Deal usable.

hook.text: Setting a valuation for a company with no revenue is like pricing a painting before it's finished.

buildup.text: A convertible note avoids this: it's a loan that converts into equity at the next funding round.

discovery.text: The investor gets a discount (usually 20%) and a valuation cap as a reward for betting early.

twist.text: If the startup never raises again, the note stays as debtâ€”and debt must be repaid.

climax.text: Y Combinator popularized the SAFE noteâ€”simpler, no interest, no maturity date.

punchline.text: A convertible note says: 'Let's agree on the price later.'

quiz.question: Why do early-stage startups use convertible notes?
options: They delay valuation negotiations until the company has more data to price fairly
They offer lower interest rates than bank loans
They give investors immediate equity ownership
